class lib.cuckoo.common.abstracts.BehaviorHandler(behavior_analysis)¶

Bases: object

Base class for behavior handlers inside of BehaviorAnalysis.

event_types = []¶
handle_event(event)¶

Handle an event that gets passed down the stack.

handles_path(logpath)¶

Needs to return True for the log files this handler wants to process.

key = 'undefined'¶
parse(logpath)¶

Called after handles_path succeeded, should generate behavior events.

run()¶

Return the handler specific structure, gets placed into behavior[self.key].

class lib.cuckoo.common.abstracts.LibVirtMachinery¶

Bases: lib.cuckoo.common.abstracts.Machinery

Libvirt based machine manager.

If you want to write a custom module for a virtualization software supported by libvirt you have just to inherit this machine manager and change the connection string.

ABORTED = 'abort'¶
ERROR = 'machete'¶
PAUSED = 'paused'¶
POWEROFF = 'poweroff'¶
RUNNING = 'running'¶
dump_memory(label, path)¶

Takes a memory dump. @param path: path to where to store the memory dump.

initialize(module)¶

Initialize machine manager module. Override default to set proper connection string. @param module: machine manager module

shutdown()¶

Override shutdown to free libvirt handlers - they print errors.

start(label, task)¶

Starts a virtual machine. @param label: virtual machine name. @param task: task object. @raise CuckooMachineError: if unable to start virtual machine.

stop(label)¶

Stops a virtual machine. Kill them all. @param label: virtual machine name. @raise CuckooMachineError: if unable to stop virtual machine.

class lib.cuckoo.common.abstracts.Machinery¶

Bases: object

Base abstract class for machinery modules.

LABEL = 'label'¶
acquire(machine_id=None, platform=None, tags=None)¶

Acquire a machine to start analysis. @param machine_id: machine ID. @param platform: machine platform. @param tags: machine tags @return: machine or None.

availables()¶

How many machines are free. @return: free machines count.

dump_memory(label, path)¶

Takes a memory dump of a machine. @param path: path to where to store the memory dump.

initialize(module_name)¶

Read, load, and verify machines configuration. @param module_name: module name.

machines()¶

List virtual machines. @return: virtual machines list

pcap_path(task_id)¶

Returns the .pcap path for this task id.

release(label=None)¶

Release a machine. @param label: machine name.

running()¶

Returns running virtual machines. @return: running virtual machines list.

set_options(options)¶

Set machine manager options. @param options: machine manager options dict.

set_status(label, status)¶

Set status for a virtual machine. @param label: virtual machine label @param status: new virtual machine status

shutdown()¶

Shutdown the machine manager. Kills all alive machines. @raise CuckooMachineError: if unable to stop machine.

start(label, task)¶

Start a machine. @param label: machine name. @param task: task object. @raise NotImplementedError: this method is abstract.

stop(label=None)¶

Stop a machine. @param label: machine name. @raise NotImplementedError: this method is abstract.

class lib.cuckoo.common.abstracts.Signature(caller)¶

Bases: object

Base class for Cuckoo signatures.

alert = False¶
authors = []¶
categories = []¶
check_dll_loaded(pattern, regex=False, actions=None, pid=None, all=False)¶

Checks for DLLs being loaded. @param pattern: string or expression to check for. @param regex: boolean representing if the pattern is a regular

expression or not and therefore should be compiled.

@param pid: The process id to check. If it is set to None, all

processes will be checked.

@return: boolean with the result of the check.

check_domain(pattern, regex=False, all=False)¶

Checks for a domain being contacted. @param pattern: string or expression to check for. @param regex: boolean representing if the pattern is a regular

expression or not and therefore should be compiled.

@return: boolean with the result of the check.

check_file(pattern, regex=False, actions=None, pid=None, all=False)¶

Checks for a file being opened. @param pattern: string or expression to check for. @param regex: boolean representing if the pattern is a regular

expression or not and therefore should be compiled.

@param actions: a list of key actions to use. @param pid: The process id to check. If it is set to None, all

processes will be checked.

@return: boolean with the result of the check.

check_ip(pattern, regex=False, all=False)¶

Checks for an IP address being contacted. @param pattern: string or expression to check for. @param regex: boolean representing if the pattern is a regular

expression or not and therefore should be compiled.

@return: boolean with the result of the check.

check_key(pattern, regex=False, actions=None, pid=None, all=False)¶

Checks for a registry key being accessed. @param pattern: string or expression to check for. @param regex: boolean representing if the pattern is a regular

expression or not and therefore should be compiled.

@param actions: a list of key actions to use. @param pid: The process id to check. If it is set to None, all

processes will be checked.

@return: boolean with the result of the check.

check_mutex(pattern, regex=False, all=False)¶

Checks for a mutex being opened. @param pattern: string or expression to check for. @param regex: boolean representing if the pattern is a regular

expression or not and therefore should be compiled.

@return: boolean with the result of the check.

check_url(pattern, regex=False, all=False)¶

Checks for a URL being contacted. @param pattern: string or expression to check for. @param regex: boolean representing if the pattern is a regular

expression or not and therefore should be compiled.

@return: boolean with the result of the check.

get_command_lines()¶

Retrieves all command lines used.

get_dll_loaded(pid=None)¶

Get DLLs loaded by a specific process.

@param pid: the process or None for all @return: yields DLLs loaded

get_droidmon(section=None, default={})¶

Returns the droidmon results for this analysis.

get_files(pid=None, actions=None)¶

Get files read, queried, or written to optionally by a specific process.

@param pid: the process or None for all @param actions: actions to search for. None is all @return: yields files

get_googleplay(section=None, default={})¶

Returns the Google Play results for this analysis.

get_keys(pid=None, actions=None)¶

Get registry keys.

@param pid: The pid to look in or None for all. @param actions: the actions as a list. @return: yields registry keys

get_mutexes(pid=None)¶

@param pid: Pid to filter for @return:List of mutexes

@param pid: pid to search for. @return: process.

get_processes(name=None)¶

Get a list of processes.

@param name: If set only return processes with that name. @return: List of processes or empty list

get_volatility(module=None)¶

Returns the data that belongs to the given module.

get_wmi_queries()¶

Retrieves all executed WMI queries.

has_marks(count=None)¶

Returns true if this signature has one or more marks.

init()¶

Allow signatures to initialize themselves.

mark(**kwargs)¶

Mark arbitrary data.

mark_call(*args, **kwargs)¶

Mark the current call as explanation as to why this signature matched.

mark_ioc(category, ioc, description=None)¶

Mark an IOC as explanation as to why the current signature matched.

mark_vol(plugin, **kwargs)¶

Mark output of a Volatility plugin as explanation as to why the current signature matched.

markcount = 50¶
maximum = None¶
minimum = None¶
name = ''¶
on_call(call, process)¶

Notify signature about API call. Return value determines if this signature is done or could still match.

Only called if signature is “active”.

@param call: logged API call. @param process: proc object.

on_call_dispatch = False¶
on_complete()¶

Signature is notified when all API calls have been processed.

on_process(process)¶

Called on process change.

Can be used for cleanup of flags, re-activation of the signature, etc.

@param process: dictionary describing this process

on_signature(signature)¶

Event yielded when another signatures has matched. Some signatures only take effect when one or more other signatures have matched as well.

@param signature: The signature that just matched

order = 1¶
platform = None¶
references = []¶
results()¶

Turn this signature into actionable results.

severity = 1¶
